titleInfo.title: Trigonometrical Survey of Clarence’s Strait, Gulf of Persia. By Commr. G.B. Brucks and Lieutt. S.B. Haines. H.C. Marine 1828. ‘Engraved by R. Bateman. Sheet 2nd’

physicalDescription.extent: Dimensions:526 x 699 mm, on sheet 562 x 774 mm

mods.abstract: Imprint:Published by James Horsburgh, Hydrographer to the East India Company.Distinctive Features:Relief shown by hachures. Depth shown by soundings.Nautical chart of the Clarence Strait in the Persian Gulf compiled from the surveys carried out by the Bombay Marine’s officers between 1820 and 1829. Depicts the coastline of the mainland and the western part of the Island Kishm [Qeshm] with areas dry at low water stippled and indicated by a dotted line.Continuation of the map entitled ‘Sheet 1’ is held at IOR/X/3630/28/1.
